page.title: 03Ecology in Whitley
page.content: As Whitley is a WHITEBELT area the natural life in and around it, is very healthy. Foxes,badgers,rabbits & hares can be seen at dusk and dawn hopping and leaping about in the fields. Blue- bells, Cowparsley & Shepherd's Purse grow abundantly on the narrow sides of Whitleys quiet country lanes.There are hundreds of different kinds of birds in Whitley ranging from wrens to owls & also there are a few ducks & water birds. Most families have pets such as cats, dogs, hamsters, gerbils, guinea- pigs & horses. On farms we have cows ,pigs, chickens & sheep. There is a nature conservation trust in our area and several of our villagers are part of it. The land is a sandy loam with small ponds and woods for wildlife and the farm land is mainly grass for milk and grazing and there is some arable land for corn, roots and potatoes.
